Moon

The Moon orbits the Earth and takes around 27 days to complete. Also, the moon does not actually produce its own light instead it reflects light from the sun. Adding on, the reason the moon appears different everyday is because the sun is shining on different parts of the surface each night. Finally, the first people to step on the moon were Neil Armstrong and Buzz Aldrin with the Apollo 11 mission back in 1969. Source (Nat Geo).
